III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was involved in a heated conversation inside of the
facility and walked out of the facility. Youth A has been outside for
almost an hour and staff have not attempted to speak with youth
or verify her well-being.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
08/21/2024.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/22/2024.
Administrator reported Youth A was transferred to Independent
Living Program (ILP) this morning. Youth A has been at the facility
for two years and has completed the program. Youth A has been
frustrated and acting out because she wanted to transfer to ILP.
She said Youth A had AWOLed over the weekend, but she is not
aware that Youth A AWOLed on 08/21/2024.
Director was interviewed at the facility on 08/22/2024. Director
reported she and Youth A were meeting on 08/21/2024 about her
transitioning to an ILP and she became frustrated because the
process was taking so long. Youth A walked out of the building
and Staff 1 followed Youth A. She said Youth A never left the
grounds. Youth A sat on the bench in the courtyard and Staff 1
never lost line of sight of Youth A. Youth A’s father had given her
a telephone and she was on the phone while she was outside.
Director reported Youth A is not supposed to have a cell phone.
Youth A’s father gave her a cell phone even though she is not
allowed to have a cell phone. Youth A refused to hand over the
cell phone and she kept the phone in her bra, so staff would not
take it from her.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/22/2024, Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for two months. She was assigned to
Youth A’s unit on 08/21/2024. She reported Youth A ran out to the
2

courtyard after having a conversation with the director. She
followed Youth A outside. Youth A sat on the bench and was
outside on her phone for approximately 30 minutes. Staff 1 said
she was watching Youth A from the entrance of the building for
the entire duration Youth A was outside. She admitted that she did
not speak to Youth A, because Youth A was upset, and she did
not want to trigger her. She said Youth A was talking on the cell
phone and did not leave the courtyard. Youth A came back into
the building approximately 30 minutes after being outside.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 08/22/2024. Staff 2
reported she witnessed Youth A go outside to the courtyard. She
said Staff 1 followed Youth A and was watching her while she was
outside. Staff 2 said Youth A can be very challenging due to her
not wanting to be at the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 08/22/2024.
Supervisor reported she witnessed Youth A walk out of the
building on 08/21/2024 and she sat in the courtyard. She said
Staff 1 was assigned to supervise Youth A while she was outside.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 08/22/2024. Youth B
has been at the facility for one year. Youth B reported there is
always a staff member supervising. Youth B is not on the same
unit as Youth A but is familiar with Youth A. Youth B denied
witnessing Youth A leave the facility on 08/21/2024. Youth B
admitted he has AWOLed in the past and said staff follow him and
try to verbally discourage him when he AWOLs. Youth A reported
feeling safe and did not express any concerns regarding staff.
Youth A was interviewed at the ILP facility on 08/22/2024. Youth
A is 17 years old. Youth A was in the process of getting set up in
her new placement. Youth A reported she is very excited about
this new placement. Youth A admitted on 08/21/2024 she was
frustrated because she wanted to be moved to her current
placement and went outside to the courtyard. She said Staff 1 did
follow her outside and was outside for a few minutes, but Staff 1
went back in the building. Youth A said she was outside for about
one hour. Youth A said she was talking on her phone the whole-
time and staff did not come outside to check on her. Youth A said
she went back in the building and saw Staff 1 by the door. Youth A
admitted she has AWOLed in the past and staff do follow and try
to talk her out of AWOLing.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
08/23/2024. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A has a history of
3

AWOLing and the facility does notify her and provides incident
reports. She said Youth A is very stubborn and will act out if she
does not get her way. She did not have any concerns regarding
the facility or supervision.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 08/18/2024 written by Staff 2. Youth A
AWOLed by exiting out of the window. Youth A ran across
Washington Avenue between houses. Law enforcement
and worker were notified.
• Staffing Policy: Staff ratios are 1:3 during waking hours and
1:8 sleeping hours.
• Facility policy titled “Residential AWOL Protocol” was
reviewed. Staff are expected to maintain line of sight until
the youth leaves the agency property. Upon the event of an
AWOL staff will contact supervisor, and the supervisor will
assist in the process of reporting the youth AWOL to law
enforcement and notifying parent/legal guardian, probation
officer and case manager.
• Personnel file for Staff 1-no disciplinary actions
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews with staff and
Youth A was being supervised by staff while she was outside.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
